website_summaries.verdict: A good option if you're looking for a versatile belt made of webbing.
pros: Reinforced webbing holds a concealed weapon and other gear if necessary
Buckle doesn't slip even with intense activity
cons: Runs small, making sizing problematic at times

customer_reviews.title: Missing a few ounces of quality.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I thought. It's been over ten years since I bought my first riggers belt at 29 palms...I like them so much that I bought two. I used those belts while in Iraq and Africa...I still have them now. I purchased this belt thinking I would end up with the same quality that I have come to trust over the last ten + years of duty and carry but not so. This belt is thin and the clasps and buckles seem cheap. I think it would be okay if my expectation wasnt set so high by the belts I purchased so long ago.
customer_reviews.author: Excelsious

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy a different belt unless I need one for church or dressing up for a hot date. If I fluctuate in weight every other month I still get a tight fit with the adjustable Velcro strap. I like that fact that I can repel if needed in an emergency situation. I still would prefer a harness if I was going to be climbing and repelling all day. Stitching and quality top notch. I don’t think I’ll need to replace this belt until the Velcro wears.
customer_reviews.author: GearChief

customer_reviews.title: Low grade material
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Blackhawk rigger belt before, the quality has gone down. the material used is lesser than the belts I've bought before. Thickness of the belt is also a factor, it's thinner than the other Blackhawk belts before. Bad all around.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself over and over again.
customer_reviews.text: Got this rigger belt a few years back and its till holding up perfectly. Beat the hell out of it between hunting, rock climb and other outdoors stuff. Also used this to be hoisted up the mast when sailing, Excellent quality and worth more than the money. ** Please note: This is for the real BLACKHAWK belt. Not the fake one that people have saying they have received.**
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Tough!
customer_reviews.text: Great supportive belt, I've used it as a gunbelt and kidney belt on a 72 hour bag and it was comfortable in both with roles. Only downside is that it makes one o'clock appendix difficult in regards to holster selection bc the belt doubles over after passing through the buckle and folding back over and this caused the holster to tilt forwards and pushed the grip into my concealement garment. However as a 3/4 o'clock CCW holster it's great.
customer_reviews.author: KnifemakingPrepper

customer_reviews.title: It works but not 1st choice.
customer_reviews.text: Returning asap, going with the Condor instead. Better all around belt in places that matter most. Condor lighter green vs. Blackhawk darker green.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Actual size.
customer_reviews.text: First review I've written for Amazon. I went by sizing from other reviews on Amazon. Some of you guys might want to remeasure your waists. The belt is great as expected, solid webbing, double stitched. Obviously very durable. However, I have a 32" waist and ordered a medium. The medium comes at 46" long, leaving 14" to wrap clear to my back. God help the guy who needs a rigger belt and also has to order the large. If you are an averaged size man, the small will more than suffice. The fuzzy part of the Velcro is 25.5" and the hooked part of the Velcro is 4.25". You can't cut and burn it. It will have to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THe first & last belt you will need for the field
customer_reviews.text: This belt is heavy duty & takes abuse like a champ, I have owned this belt now for 6 months & working in the field with it has proven its durability. it has been expose to cold weather, rain,head & even abuse & it still holds up like the first day I received it. If you work outside and needs a utility belt and not sure what to purchase, get this one. It is the only belt you will ever need for when in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Riggers belt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was tired of my leather belts stretching and eventually breaking due to me putting a toolbelt on at work all day. This belt is small enough that it fits through normal pant belt loops but is also super heavy duty. I have had it for almost 6 months now and I love it. I use it everyday and while camping. While camping i have a first aid kit thigh rig looped in on one side and my .45 thigh rig on the other, it takes some of the weight and doesn't feel bulky at all. Its a heavy duty belt that seems as though it could last forever. Excellent quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent belt!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of the belt in which the Velcro didn't work so well from so many years of use. In terms of quality, fit and finish what more can I say that its from Blackhawk! I will definitely be buying another when this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: VA944S

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect color description
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed a belt for his military uniform. We figured olive drab would be correct because most of his gear is olive colored. This belt was more of a dark hunter green than olive. Quality seemed decent though. They charge for return shipping though, so exchanging the color is a bit of a burden.
customer_reviews.author: Sapphire

customer_reviews.title: Made to last
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for 10 years and wore it on a daily basis, plus during 5 deployments. The Velcro does not get worn out. A civilian friend saw me wearing mine, so I ordered her one. She loves it! These belts will stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Top Z

customer_reviews.title: Improved my life.
customer_reviews.text: Every time I suit up with this belt I'm utterly satisfied. You know when you buy something new and it's exciting for a short while? This belt is so perfect that the joy doesn't fade. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Minetto

customer_reviews.title: A bit bulky...
customer_reviews.text: A bit too clunky and bulky for me and I returned it. It was obviously very well built and probably would have lasted forever but it wasn't what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Dave U.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, and lighter than my leather belt
customer_reviews.text: My only issue with this is how difficult it is to put on and take off. It's not a deal breaker, but it seems that the process could be easier. Other than that it seems extremely well made and durable, and it fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ethosian

customer_reviews.title: Good solid belt.
customer_reviews.text: Great belt, a bit stiff, tightens well and resists slippage. May be a bit wide for some looped carry-on items, so keep this in mind. Sturdy, not particularly comfortable, however.
customer_reviews.author: MrTruth

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect belt I sadly got the wrong size. But I'm going to reorder the same belt different size!
customer_reviews.author: leonard Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Solid belt
customer_reviews.text: It’s a solid belt they cost 60 at px on base. It’s used for a seat out waiver to ride in a hueghy. It a reliable belt by a good manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hoyos

customer_reviews.title: Great as a tool belt
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality. Doesn't work with all pants. I use it as a tool belt for my pouches at work & it's great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Rossborough

customer_reviews.title: High quality designed for arduous use
customer_reviews.text: All aspects of this belt are heavy duty designed for arduous use. Although it will not win any fashion reviews, it is superlative for outdoor work.
customer_reviews.author: Maggot

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Extreme duty, inexpensive, and much higher quality than I expected. It's worth twice it's price point.
customer_reviews.author: thewalrus

customer_reviews.title: Tough to find rt size I'm 38 waist This one ...
customer_reviews.text: Tough to find rt size I'm 38 waist This one too small next size too big
customer_reviews.author: Brian schwalm

customer_reviews.title: Riggers belt
customer_reviews.text: Very good belt, comfortable to wear in the field and most pants accomidate the width of the belt.
customer_reviews.author: Ed A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love how sturdy the belt is. Too bad I got it a bit small, but not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: I deducted two stars because the color is definitely olive ...
customer_reviews.text: I deducted two stars because the color is definitely NOT olive drab--think of green but christmas tree green. It is a very bright kermit the frog green, which is completely not how it is pictured.
customer_reviews.author: eeyon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredibly sturdy item. Your other belts are going to feel pretty flimsy after wearing this for a day.
customer_reviews.author: mgriff9

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy belt!
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these and they both work great. Nice way to add a secure mount to your waist.
customer_reviews.author: MODist

customer_reviews.title: Blackhawk quality
customer_reviews.text: Durable and comfortable. Most other belts have the rough velcro facing out which would grab at sweatshirts and collect lint. This one is the opposite which solves the problem. If you need a quality belt look no further.
customer_reviews.author: William Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is very pleased with this product. He purchased it for his work, the product fits very comfortably on him.
customer_reviews.author: Ella Gentry

customer_reviews.title: It was great! Very sturdy and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this belt to use for an endurance event. It was great! Very sturdy and great quality! I have used it several time and have had no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie McGrew

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one I was issued. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I was issued this belt from my Army unit when I was in. I've since lost my awesome riggers belt and now I have it again. I love this belt. It actually works to.. If you like to swing around on 550 cord..
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: great rugged weapon platform
customer_reviews.text: great belt..you wont be dissapointed. wasent my first choice, but wasent willing to wait 4 weeks for other belts, and im glad i didnt. more than enough belt right here..
customer_reviews.author: John Holland

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty belt. I wear a size 34 and the medium was the perfect size
customer_reviews.author: Gbrunkstl

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is a mystery
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is a problem. I bought the Medium as it is stated to fit up to 40" waist. No way. I wear 36" pants everyday (jeans and khakis), am 220lbs and 5'10" with a middle age little gut. This belt is short- just not much material to get through the buckle and then velcro'ed down.
customer_reviews.author: Lifesanadventure

customer_reviews.title: Exellent belt
customer_reviews.text: Great belt, exellent product, good quality, proper fit, the belt is very heavy duty construction, Overall an amazing belt .
customer_reviews.author: MARTIN RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: Heavy-duty gun belt?  No!
customer_reviews.text: Weak side wall. Can't support a heavy pistol without flopping around. A good gun belt doesn't need 2 pounds of buckle, it needs a strong sidewall to support lateral weight, and this belt is a total fail in that category. To add insult to injury, the color I received was bright green rather than olive drab (as pictured). This belt is "Halloween Costume" grade.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Rigger belt was shipped without the extra thick heavy duty plastic case
customer_reviews.text: If you order the rigger belt from this company don't expect to get the thick heavy duty plastic case that zip closes at the top. I specifically wanted this extra strong heavy duty plastic case that normally comes with the rigger belt, to store some of my other gear. If you order from a different company you will get the extra heavy duty plastic case with the rigger belt. Just wanted everyone to know you will not be getting the extra heavy duty plastic case if you order your rigger belt from this company. As for the rigger belt itself? I own three of them... (Good Stiff Quality)
customer_reviews.author: Back40Mike

product_meta.title: BLACKHAWK CQB/Rigger's Belt
product_meta.description:
BLACKHAWK!'s CQB/Rigger's Belt offers parachute grade buckles and adapters, 1.75” webbing (7,000 lb tensile strength), and includes a hook and loop that secures running end. The belt is offered in four colors: Coyote Tan, Desert Sand Brown, Black and Olive Drab. the belt is measured from the buckle where it attaches to the belt, to the angled tip of the belt, it should measure about 3 to 4 inches longer that the advertised length.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :1 x 2 x 2 inches; 0.8 Ounces
 * Item model number :41CQ01OD
 * Department :Mens
 * Date First Available :February 28, 2008
 * Manufacturer :BLACKHAWK
 * ASIN :B001TIJP6W

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #13,312 in Sports & Outdoors (See Top 100 in Sports & Outdoors)  *  #8 inHunting Safety Belts & Harnesses 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.2 out of 5 stars92 ratings BLACKHAWK!'s CQB/Rigger's Belt offers parachute grade buckles and adapters, 1.75” webbing (7,000 lb tensile strength), and includes a hook and loop that secures running end. The belt is offered in four colors: Coyote Tan, Desert Sand Brown, Black and Olive Drab. the belt is measured from the buckle where it attaches to the belt, to the angled tip of the belt, it should measure about 3 to 4 inches longer that the advertised length.
feature_bullets: Parachute-grade buckles and adapters meet PIA-H-7195 standards
MIL-STD-858 with parachute grade buckles and adapters
Hook and loop secures running end
Three sizes: Small (up to 30"), Medium (up to 40"), and Large (41"-51").
Four colors: Black, Olive Drab, Desert Sand Brown, and Coyote Tan.
Three sizes: Small (to 34”), Medium (to 41”), Large (41”-51”). Size 34", 41" and 41"-51" mentions Waist size and not belt size
